definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
forced labor (as punishment in criminal case)

pinyin: qiang3 po4 xing4 chu3 wu4 zheng4
qiang3 po4 xing4 xing4 xing2 wei2

definition: drive-by download (a form of malware booby-trap)/silent drive-by download
pinyin: yin3 bi4 qiang3 po4 xia4 zai4

sentences.english: You shouldn't force food on children.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该强迫孩子们吃东西。

sentences.english: Forced diuresis e. g. management of barbiturate poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 强迫利尿，例如管理巴比妥中毒。

sentences.english: Accentric block vibrating mechanism is applied to break the earth for pile sinking pipe to set down.
sentences.chinese: 采用偏心块振动式机构，强迫振动土壤破裂下沉桩管。

sentences.english: OCD patients feel compelled to repeat behaviours such as washing their hands.
sentences.chinese: 强迫症患者倍感强迫来重复一系列行为，如重复洗手。

sentences.english: OCD patients feel compelled to repeat behaviours such as washing their hands.
sentences.chinese: 强迫症患者倍感强迫来重复一系列行为，如重复洗手。

sentences.english: Well, I guess I should've known. He just kept making me watch Moulin Rouge.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我早就该猜到了他总是强迫我看《红磨坊》。

sentences.english: Do you have any work habits that you can't get rid of outside of your job?
sentences.chinese: 你不工作的时候，有没有什么职业强迫症？

sentences.english: There's a compulsive problem to working at a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 在餐厅工作会有一个强迫性问题。

sentences.english: So could compulsive buying be an addiction disorder?
sentences.chinese: 那么强迫购买行为是一种成瘾症吗？

sentences.english: Compulsion will never result in convincing them .
sentences.chinese: 强迫永远不会使他们信服。

sentences.english: His relentless aggression bludgeons you into seeing his point.
sentences.chinese: 他咄咄逼人地强迫你了解他的看法。

sentences.english: We tend to think of hypochondria as a kind of selfishness.
sentences.chinese: 我们倾向于将强迫症视为某种自私的表现。

sentences.english: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.
sentences.chinese: 有人要强迫你走一里路，就陪他走两里。

sentences.english: Help is someone forcing you to gain weight.
sentences.chinese: 帮助是某个人强迫你去增加体重。

sentences.english: But the cafeteria is doing its best to force me to be a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 但是饭堂竭力在强迫我成为一名素食主义者。

sentences.english: extended solitary confinement is likely to induce either obsessive behavior or delirium.
sentences.chinese: 过长的禁闭可能引发强迫行为或谵妄。

definition: to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
